title: Nio Selector Issue on Linux Platform
description: The server's CPU consistently reaches and maintains 100% usage until a restart occurs. This behavior has been observed on multiple Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021. There's a mention of a potentially related issue, Bug 46373, which seems to have been addressed by the Jetty team (http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel). Additional logging has been added to NioEndpoint.java to investigate further.
OB: The server's CPU usage spikes to 100% and remains at that level continuously until a server restart is performed.
EB: The expected behavior is that the server's CPU usage should not consistently reach 100% and remain at that level indefinitely. It should handle requests without causing prolonged 100% CPU usage.
SR:
1. Run the web application using NioEndpoint.java on a Linux platform.
2. Perform multiple requests to the application by pressing F5 in the browser and keeping the button pressed.
3. Observe the server's CPU usage reaching and staying at 100% until the server is restarted.
